structural_analysis.context_justification: The text contains headers for Mundaka 2 (द्वितीय) and Khanda 1 (प्रथम). The first parsed unit is Mantra 1. Thus, the start ID is 2.1.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines the grantha ID, a slug for the commentary author, and the zero-padded start ID (02-01-01) for unique, sortable file naming.

proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive Khandas, strictly ensuring no chunk exceeds the safety character limit. The plan is regenerated internally if any proposed chunk is too large.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Mundaka is primarily divided into Khandas, which are the main semantic and structural sections of the text.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed within double dandas at the end of the mantra line (e.g., ।।१।।, ।। २ ।।).

start_pattern.description: A new Khanda begins with a bolded heading indicating its Mundaka and Khanda number.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Khanda is marked by a concluding colophon line specifying the Mundaka and Khanda of the commentary.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Parse any unnumbered thematic headings (e.g., **[अक्षरात् जगत्सृष्टिः]**) and prefatory phrases (e.g., **तदेतत् सत्यम् ।।**) that appear after the Khanda start pattern but before the first numbered mantra as introductory content for that Khanda.
